exampleDrills.title: Example Drills
exampleDrills.description: These are example drills that can be used during the game or in separate practices. Adapt as needed.

section1.title: 1. 30 min / Gathering
section1.goal: Goal: Create positive atmosphere, go through the day's agenda.
points: High-fives, fist bumps, how are you – sharing updates
Themes based on practices – may vary, but "Enjoy" is always included.

section2.title: 2. 20 min / Warm-up
section2.goal: Goal: Raise body temperature, tune mind for the game.
points: Pair lines + marker 5m away (cone/bib), circle outside to end of own line
Animal movements: inchworm, bear crawl, duck walk (kids can suggest)
Sprints (approx. 5): standing start, sitting start, push-up start

section3.title: 3. 10 min / Ball Work
section3.goal: Goal: Activate ball touch and prepare for the game.
pairWorkPoints: Basic passing close → further away (game stance, balls of feet, inside foot, care)
goalieWarmupPoints: Up, side, in the air, along the ground (gets used to the ball)
combinedWarmupPoints: GK in goal → wall pass → shot from 16m / between penalty spot (coach can act as wall)

section4.title: 4. 2 min / Substitution Area
section4.goal: Goal: Final tuning before the game.
points: Timing just before entering the field (referee ready)

duringGame.title: During the game:
points: Encourage good performances (e.g., fist bumps, "yes!", "just like we practiced!")
Let the player make decisions – guide only off-ball players and substitutes if needed
